Learn Markdown

Markdown is the "language" in which those in the IT world write and communicate. It is a markup language and not a programming language per se. Learning markdown syntax is a very invaluable skill in this field. Even if you don’t have any plans on having any data skills, trust me when I tell you it is in your best interest to learn the markdown syntax. If you like the design of this website, then I am happy to let you know that this entire blogpost with its formatting was written in markdown. It can be learnt from between 2 days to about a week. Below are some resources to help you get started using Markdown. Refer to the guide by Markdown Guide website for general and detailed information about what you can use markdown for.

Structure of the DataCamp Certifications

DataCamp offers the following tracks for learners to choose from so they get the best custom-based learning experience:

  1. Organization Track: A collection of well-curated courses by yourscholarshipp organization or DataCamp, to guide your learning and help you gain new skills.

  2. Skill Track: Acquire new skills fast in courses that combine short expert videos with immediate hands-on exercises. This is based on particular skill sets learners wish to acquire.

  3. Career Track consists of hand-picked courses by industry experts. You will learn all you need to start a new career in the data science field. This is based on the career options of the learners.

Learning Platforms on Datacamp

  • Interactive Courses offered by DataCamp: Combine short videos with hands-on exercises.
  • Practice Exercises are also offered by DataCamp. Targeted at those who wish to Keep their skills sharp with quick daily challenges on desktop or Mobile app. You earn XP for every practice round.
  • DataCamp Signal™ Assessments: To help gauge your skill level before starting any of the career tracks. How do your skills stack up? Discover your skill level in just 10 minutes to get personalized learning recommendations.

Practice Platforms on DataCamp

  1. DataCamp Projects: Apply your skills using tools like data Notebooks and complete a data analysis from start to finish.
  2. DataCamp Case Studies: These hands-on scenarios give you a chance to navigate real-world problems across diverse industries.
  3. DataCamp Code Alongs: During which, experienced DataCamp instructors will guide you through a vast selection of real world problems from start to finish.
  4. DataCamp Competitions: Feeling a little bit adventurous? DataCamp competitions give you an opportunity to showcase your skillsets and even get to earn some cash while doing what you love!!!
  5. DataCamp Tutorials: Develop your data science skills with tutorials. It covers everything from data visualizations in Tableau to version control in Git.
  6. Popular Topics: Get ahead with the popular topics on DataCamp. Everything you need for each topic has been put in one place.

DataCamp Certifications

Take the next step in your career and prove your competencies with DataCamp recognized career, technology, and fundamentals certifications (shown above). If you’re not quite ready for that next step, you can also prepare yourself with some tailored learning plans.

DataCamp Certifications

DataCamp certifications are developed in partnership with industry experts. They can help expand career opportunities, increase earning potential, and demonstrate expertise.

Duration

You’ll have 30 days or 2 attempts to pass and get certified.

DataCamp offers both Associate and Professional certifications, designed to reflect entry-level and more experienced skill levels, respectively. The main difference between the two is the difficulty of the questions and the final exam requirements.

  • Associate certification: Designed for those starting out, and aligns with entry-level job expectations. It consists of a series of DataCamp assessments.

  • Professional certification: Designed for those with at least two years of experience. It requires a written and verbal presentation for the final exam.

  • DataCamp Learning Plans towards Certifications: DataCamp allows you to build a plan from scratch or take assessments to target lessons specifically for you.

Register for a DataCamp Certification

Number of Attempts

Once you begin a certification you will have 30 days or 2 attempts to complete all requirements, whichever occurs first. If you’re unable to complete the requirements within 30 days from starting, your progress will reset.

Interview Prep

After getting certified, make use of the DataCamp AI interview prep tool to get a feel of how real-life job interviews can be for a data role

Import Important Libraries

To get started on this journey, here is a skeleton of all the important Python libraries/modules you need to import. I have created this code to prevent having to type out the same codes from scratch for every project.

Feel free to modify and use it as you wish. I will also be updating the code regularly, whenever I add contents to this EduTechTainMent Data Career Resources and Guide.

Steps Download the file via this LINK. Save the file in a convenient location, preferably a cloud storage directory you can access remotely on any device you are connected to. I would strongly recommend Koofr, which gives you 5 to 10Gb storage space and allows you to connect and sync your files seamlessly across multiple devices- desktop PC, laptops, android mobile phones, as well as connect and sync files from other popular cloud storages such as Google Drive, OneDrive, and DropBox. It aslo supprots WebDav. I use Koofr seamlessly across about 3 laptops, 2 desktop PCs and 1 android smartphone. I can access all my files from all these devices from anywhere in the world, and I don’t get restricted by location.

Load the file into your Jupyter notebook by running the code below without the quotation marks.

Show the code 
%load “path_to_the_import_packages.py_file”

For example, this is the path to my file on my PC: load C:\Users\Admin\Koofr\import_packages.py

Finally, run the cell on your Jupyter notebook.

How do I Learn if Can’t Afford a Decent Specs Laptop or Don’t have a Personal Laptop or Desktop Computer?

Are you constrained by lack of a decent specification laptop or even desktop computer system? Don’t sweat !!! EduTechTainMent has got you covered. You can utilize the following methods to have access to a platform to learn and pratice your Data skills:

  1. DataLab by DataCamp
  2. Deepnote: The Education plan gives you all the benefits of the team Plan at no cost. You can also get the free version if you don’t have an educational institution email account. Use your mobile phone (read how to do that below).
  3. Google Colab
  4. Make use of your mobile phone as a last resort. Although its not the best, user-experience wise, it at least enables you to get started practicing without the need to procrastinate due to unavailability of a laptop computer. I will be sharing a guide on how to use you smartphone for this purpose soon. Just stay tuned.
